subject: Medicine
title: How We Forget
description: A 60-second lesson on How We Forget.

hook.text: You forget 70% of new information within 24 hours. Forgetting isn't a flawâ€”it's a feature.

buildup.text: The forgetting curve shows rapid decay of memory unless information is reviewed or reinforced.

discovery.text: Forgetting filters out unimportant details so the brain can focus on what matters for survival.

twist.text: People who can't forget suffer. A woman named Jill Price remembers every day of her life and calls it a burden.

climax.text: Spaced repetition exploits the forgetting curveâ€”reviewing at increasing intervals cements memory efficiently.

punchline.text: Forgetting makes room for what matters.

quiz.question: Why is forgetting considered a feature rather than a flaw?
options: It filters out unimportant details to focus on what matters
It prevents the brain from overheating
It only removes memories that cause emotional pain
